projects.brand_about: Namonai is a online art platform based in Tokyo. The company nurtures and empowers budding Japanese artists to manage and sell their artwork globally. The name 'Namonai' is Japanese, 「名も無い」, meaning 'Not even a name'. We aim to build this platform for Japanese artists who can not even claim a name yet. I am a co-founder.
projects.name: Namonai Brand, eCommerce Web Design, Frontend Development
projects.project_about:
Only 1% of the global art market is Japanese-speaking (Japan). Around 83% of the global market is English and Chinese-speaking (USA, England, China). We believe there is a high, unmet demand for Japanese art in these countries.
We are creating Namonai as a platform that breaks the Japanese-English and Japanese-Chinese language barriers to give Japanese artists a fair chance to sell their art and 'make a name' for themselves globally.
At this stage, most of my efforts focus on UXUI Design and Frontend Development of Namonai's E-Commerce site. This case study will outline my approach and general thinking for this project.
projects.seo_description: Namonai is an online fine art management platform based in Tokyo. The company helps undiscovered Japanese artists manage and sell their artwork globally through digital marketing and custom web applications.

text.content: Namonai branding is based on balance and simplicity. Our aim is to be as minimal as possible while still providing functional UX. This is to allow user artwork to shine. Namonai focuses on its artists, and therefore the brand should guide users to focus on the artists as well. Namonai is not pretentious or haughty. It's a helping hand.

rich_text.plain_text: Namonai branding is based on balance and simplicity. Our aim is to be as minimal as possible while still providing functional UX. This is to allow user artwork to shine. Namonai focuses on its artists, and therefore the brand should guide users to focus on the artists as well. Namonai is not pretentious or haughty. It's a helping hand.

text.content: The E-Commerce sitemap shows the types of static and dynamic pages in the site. Pages are divided into three categories:

rich_text.plain_text: The E-Commerce sitemap shows the types of static and dynamic pages in the site. Pages are divided into three categories:

text.content: Browsing (presentational) - for finding artwork and artists that the user likes.

rich_text.plain_text: Browsing (presentational) - for finding artwork and artists that the user likes.

text.content: Accounts (operational) - for bookmarking and buying artwork.

rich_text.plain_text: Accounts (operational) - for bookmarking and buying artwork.

text.content: Using the brand, mission, and site structure, I could begin to design the EC website. Again, the site is intentionally designed to focus on the artists and their artwork while the Namonai brand gracefully submits to a helpful information delivery platform in the background.

rich_text.plain_text: Using the brand, mission, and site structure, I could begin to design the EC website. Again, the site is intentionally designed to focus on the artists and their artwork while the Namonai brand gracefully submits to a helpful information delivery platform in the background.

text.content: The artist page is intended to act as a full-feature portfolio page for any artist that signs up for Namonai. After browsing several artists' profiles on other websites, there were a few common pieces of information:

rich_text.plain_text: The artist page is intended to act as a full-feature portfolio page for any artist that signs up for Namonai. After browsing several artists' profiles on other websites, there were a few common pieces of information:

text.content: We also provide an editable background hero image so the artist can add their own flare to their portfolio. The design focuses on artist content while balancing a familiar template layout for each artist that will provide familiarity and ease of use to the viewer.

rich_text.plain_text: We also provide an editable background hero image so the artist can add their own flare to their portfolio. The design focuses on artist content while balancing a familiar template layout for each artist that will provide familiarity and ease of use to the viewer.

text.content: The single artwork page lists all information and features that a user would need to consider buying an artwork from an artist. The design is inspired from my experience with Shopify product pages. It includes:

rich_text.plain_text: The single artwork page lists all information and features that a user would need to consider buying an artwork from an artist. The design is inspired from my experience with Shopify product pages. It includes:

text.content: Multiple, accessible shots of the artwork

rich_text.plain_text: Multiple, accessible shots of the artwork

text.content: An image to help the user imagine the artwork in real space

rich_text.plain_text: An image to help the user imagine the artwork in real space

text.content: An interesting (for non-Japanese) part of this design is the inquire button. According to our advisers, many Japanese do not like making the prices of their artwork public. Therefore, we are offering our artists the option to either display the price or inquire.

rich_text.plain_text: An interesting (for non-Japanese) part of this design is the inquire button. According to our advisers, many Japanese do not like making the prices of their artwork public. Therefore, we are offering our artists the option to either display the price or inquire.

text.content: Following, there are sections for more artwork from the artist, and other artwork suggestions. This is to offer the user more suggestions curtailed to their tastes (a concept heavily employed at Amazon).

rich_text.plain_text: Following, there are sections for more artwork from the artist, and other artwork suggestions. This is to offer the user more suggestions curtailed to their tastes (a concept heavily employed at Amazon).

text.content: I'm not a fan of most account pages - too many options. This account page is focused on the minimum information that we will need from a user to send them art when they purchase.

rich_text.plain_text: I'm not a fan of most account pages - too many options. This account page is focused on the minimum information that we will need from a user to send them art when they purchase.

text.content: The user can access this page by clicking on their profile picture in the top navigation bar. Personal information and payment information are both laid out on the same screen for simplicity. The word 'my' is used when possible, and the user's profile picture and name are emphasized to elicit a positive emotional response. Heading sizes are intentionally chosen in a clear h1, h2, h3 order to guide the users' eyes to the correct information as quickly as possible. Buttons are well pronounced and easily identifiable.

rich_text.plain_text: The user can access this page by clicking on their profile picture in the top navigation bar. Personal information and payment information are both laid out on the same screen for simplicity. The word 'my' is used when possible, and the user's profile picture and name are emphasized to elicit a positive emotional response. Heading sizes are intentionally chosen in a clear h1, h2, h3 order to guide the users' eyes to the correct information as quickly as possible. Buttons are well pronounced and easily identifiable.

text.content: The Checkout page is inspired by UX from Amazon's checkout process confirmation page. The main functions include:

rich_text.plain_text: The Checkout page is inspired by UX from Amazon's checkout process confirmation page. The main functions include:

text.content: Viewing order summary and placing order

rich_text.plain_text: Viewing order summary and placing order

text.content: In addition, I took care to ensure that the overall user experience of the checkout process matched Namonai's brand: clear and simple.

rich_text.plain_text: In addition, I took care to ensure that the overall user experience of the checkout process matched Namonai's brand: clear and simple.

text.content: We will complete version 1 of the Namonai E-Commerce site at the end of February, 2021. From there, we will test our international marketing hypotheses and continue to build our artists pool. If you'd like to learn more about our current curated artists, you can check out the Instagram page

singlePages.name: About
singlePages.overview: Digital Designer, Frontend Developer, and Digital Producer with nine+ years of professional experience in the US, Japan, and China.

text.content: Josh is a seasoned digital designer, frontend engineer, and digital producer. With nine+ years of professional experience spanning the United States, Japan, and China, he now resides in Miami, Florida, where he serves full-time as VP Design at Telcoin.

rich_text.plain_text: Josh is a seasoned digital designer, frontend engineer, and digital producer. With nine+ years of professional experience spanning the United States, Japan, and China, he now resides in Miami, Florida, where he serves full-time as VP Design at Telcoin.

text.content: Josh's overarching mission is to enhance the lives of 1,000,000 individuals by addressing complex challenges with straightforward digital design and application solutions.

rich_text.plain_text: Josh's overarching mission is to enhance the lives of 1,000,000 individuals by addressing complex challenges with straightforward digital design and application solutions.

text.content: Josh has designed and coded 30+ digital products, websites, and apps, for company sizes ranging from multinational corporations to budding startups across a variety of sectors. Some examples of sectors include eCommerce, investment banking, data analytics, telecommunications, food & beverage, music, entertainment, art commerce, blockchain, decentralized finance, and web3. He is incredibly passionate about the intersection of AI, blockchain, and finance.

rich_text.plain_text: Josh has designed and coded 30+ digital products, websites, and apps, for company sizes ranging from multinational corporations to budding startups across a variety of sectors. Some examples of sectors include eCommerce, investment banking, data analytics, telecommunications, food & beverage, music, entertainment, art commerce, blockchain, decentralized finance, and web3. He is incredibly passionate about the intersection of AI, blockchain, and finance.

text.content: Born in Okinawa, Japan, to a military family, Josh relocated to the United States when he was just two years old. His childhood was spent in many states, including North Carolina, Alaska, California, Florida, and Minnesota. Always a creative spirit, his teenage years were filled with musical endeavors and a foray into small business through 20+ part-time roles, ranging from freelance photography to bartending to English teaching.

rich_text.plain_text: Born in Okinawa, Japan, to a military family, Josh relocated to the United States when he was just two years old. His childhood was spent in many states, including North Carolina, Alaska, California, Florida, and Minnesota. Always a creative spirit, his teenage years were filled with musical endeavors and a foray into small business through 20+ part-time roles, ranging from freelance photography to bartending to English teaching.

text.content: Uncertain about his career direction, Josh began his academic journey in business school in 2010, eventually settling on an undergraduate degree in marketing. This choice allowed him to merge his passion for design and branding with the intricacies of psychology to solve real business goals. Concurrently, he began freelancing, designing marketing materials and websites that drew from the marketing principles he was studying.

rich_text.plain_text: Uncertain about his career direction, Josh began his academic journey in business school in 2010, eventually settling on an undergraduate degree in marketing. This choice allowed him to merge his passion for design and branding with the intricacies of psychology to solve real business goals. Concurrently, he began freelancing, designing marketing materials and websites that drew from the marketing principles he was studying.

text.content: Upon earning his BS degree in Marketing from the University of Minnesota Carlson School of Management, Josh's wanderlust led him back to his birthplace, Japan. In 2014, he enrolled in a bilateral exchange program at Sophia University in Tokyo, immersing himself in the Japanese language and the nuances of Japanese business culture.

rich_text.plain_text: Upon earning his BS degree in Marketing from the University of Minnesota Carlson School of Management, Josh's wanderlust led him back to his birthplace, Japan. In 2014, he enrolled in a bilateral exchange program at Sophia University in Tokyo, immersing himself in the Japanese language and the nuances of Japanese business culture.

text.content: Post-graduation, Josh secured a position as a web designer and frontend engineer at Rakuten's Creative Web Department in Tokyo. Over the next four to five years, he ventured into various roles in the Japanese tech, finance, and advertising sectors, even establishing his own freelance business. However, feeling he had reached a professional plateau, Josh returned to the U.S. in 2020, eager to tap into the tech industry's vast opportunities.

rich_text.plain_text: Post-graduation, Josh secured a position as a web designer and frontend engineer at Rakuten's Creative Web Department in Tokyo. Over the next four to five years, he ventured into various roles in the Japanese tech, finance, and advertising sectors, even establishing his own freelance business. However, feeling he had reached a professional plateau, Josh returned to the U.S. in 2020, eager to tap into the tech industry's vast opportunities.

text.content: In early 2021, Telcoin brought him on board as their Head of Design. He’s since been promoted to VP Design. In this role, Josh has cultivated a profound appreciation for blockchain and its potential, particularly in decentralized finance and web3. Since joining Telcoin we has led the design of their  webapps, and mobile iOS/Android app, and brand, while concurrently producing and managing all of Telcoin’s webapps.

rich_text.plain_text: In early 2021, Telcoin brought him on board as their Head of Design. He’s since been promoted to VP Design. In this role, Josh has cultivated a profound appreciation for blockchain and its potential, particularly in decentralized finance and web3. Since joining Telcoin we has led the design of their  webapps, and mobile iOS/Android app, and brand, while concurrently producing and managing all of Telcoin’s webapps.

text.content: When Josh isn’t designing or developing, he enjoys studying macroeconomics via Real Vision, exploring AI businesses and tools, organizing his thoughts in Notion, and learning from mentors. He goes to the gym every day, attends yoga on weekends, and loves capturing fading moments through his photography. Josh speaks Japanese with business level proficiency and is studying to do the same in Spanish. You can generally find him attending DJ events (house, bass, deep house, hardstyle) on weekends with his friends in Miami. He has 6 tattoos, a pet bearded dragon, and no car.

text.content: This webapp was designed in Figma in August 2023. The data is managed by the Notion API, a collection of databases that function as a free CMS. The frontend is created in Next.js, with Typescript React.js and TailwindCSS with some help from ChatGPT4 (Josh’s favorite frontend tech stack).
